title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 3.38 - Tuition of nonresident pupils
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 3.38 - Tuition of nonresident pupils

State Regulations

No school shall be entitled to compensation from public
moneys for the tuition of nonresident academic pupils unless such pupils, while
under instruction: (a) resided in a
district of this State which did not then maintain an approved academic
department of a grade which the pupil was qualified to enter; (b) were duly qualified for admission as
prescribed by the commissioner. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
ยง
3.38

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
